WEIGH IN PLEASE: More Crown Heights Residents Decide To Sue NYC Over Homeless Shelters?

Build it, and they will come. 

So with the dollars.

The question is where - and why.

It‚Ä¶in this scenario is this much discussed family homeless shelter in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, where a service provider is slated to get a 43-million dollar contract to run it!

The why‚Ä¶as in ‚Äúwhy here‚Äù is the question Crown Heights residents have been asking since they learned the de Blasio administration plans to ultimately *increase* the homeless presence in a community that already has 18 shelters.

PIX11 has learned the Crown Street Block Association intends to express its frustration with the city‚Äôs policies‚Ä¶in the form of legal action against the city.

SAY WHAT???? #NYC Teacher Rips Hijab Off 8-Year Old Student's Head As A Joke. No One Laughed.

Eight-year old Safa - we are not going to use her last name, or show her face - says she simply did not feel safe at P.S. 76 in the #Bronx on the afternoon of May 2nd, when her substitute teacher ripped off her hijab‚Ä¶injuring her eye in the process.

If you live in New York City - one of the most diverse in the world - then you probably don‚Äôt need us to explain what a hijab is, or why some #Muslim wear it.

The fact of the matter is, it is worn for many reasons, including as a way to demonstrate modesty, or devotion to #God. 

It is a religious custom and preference no different than Orthodox #Jewish women who choose to wear wigs and long skirts, or #Christians who choose to also dress conservatively, or wear crosses around their neck.

title: SAY WHAT???? Teacher Rips Hijab Off 8-Year Old Student's Head ...

SHARE & BE AWARE!! Are Tighter #Vaping Restrictions Coming To Your Neighborhood???

#Vape users still enjoy the right to puff away - indoors - in most counties across New York State‚Ä¶for now.

We say for now, because the state Assembly just passed a bill that expands the existing fourteen year-old Clean Indoor Air Act.

The bill's sponsor says vapes do not make smoking ‚Äúcool‚Äù, and should be treated just like regular cigarettes‚Ä¶that is, banned from restaurants and other indoor areas.

What do you think?

For so many little girls, a father‚Äôs protection can solve any problem.

But 8-year old Safa found herself all on her own earlier this month - during an encounter with her 2nd grade substitute teacher at PS 76 in the #Bronx.

Police say the teacher ripped off the #Muslim girl‚Äôs #hijab - or religious headscarf.

Fast forward to May 25th - and that substitute teacher - identified in a criminal complaint as 31-year old Oghenetega Edah, is now facing hate crime and other charges.  

Specifically: Second degree aggravated harassment, and second degree Endangering the welfare of a child.

WATCH: Battery Park City - Right Across The Street From The Former #WorldTradeCenter - Comes Back To Life

#BatteryParkCity - when it comes to desirability‚Ä¶is New York City‚Äôs ‚ÄòComeback Kid‚Äô‚Ä¶the most expensive zip code  in the country - with an average rent of just under six-thousand dollars a month - according to a new analysis completed by the real estate website RentCafe.

Who can forget just how far Battery Park City had fallen, right after the World Trade Center attacks in 2001. 

No one knew for sure whether they needed to be afraid of the potentially toxic thick layer of dust that covered this neighborhood - which is right across the street from where the Towers stood.

Some residents left their apartments - and never returned.

content:
SHARE: President Donald J. Trump promised he would do it on the campaign trail, and he followed through with this announcement to withdraw from the #ParisClimate Agreement. Here is a portion of the President's statement. Tune in to PIX 11 for access to President Trump's full remarks. 

What do you think???

For starters, here's a statement just released by President Barack Obama:

A year and a half ago, the world came together in Paris around the first-ever global agreement to set the world on a low-carbon course and protect the world we leave to our children.

It was steady, principled American leadership on the world stage that made that achievement possible.  It was bold American ambition that encouraged dozens of other nations to set their sights higher as well.  And what made that leadership and ambition possible was America‚Äôs private innovation and public investment in growing industries like wind and solar ‚Äì industries that created some of the fastest new streams of good-paying jobs in recent years, and contributed to the longest streak of job creation in our history.

Simply put, the private sector already chose a low-carbon future.  And for the nations that committed themselves to that future, the Paris Agreement opened the floodgates for businesses, scientists, and engineers to unleash high-tech, low-carbon investment and innovation on an unprecedented scale.

The nations that remain in the Paris Agreement will be the nations that reap the benefits in jobs and industries created.  I believe the United States of America should be at the front of the pack.  But even in the absence of American leadership; even as this Administration joins a small handful of nations that reject the future; I‚Äôm confident that our states, cities, and businesses will step up and do even more to lead the way, and help protect for future generations the one planet we‚Äôve got.
name: Jay Dow
title: SHARE: President Donald J. Trump‚Äã promised he would do it on t...

content: @President Donald J. Trump pulls USA put of Paris Climate Agreement. Protesters immediately mobilize.
